answers.answer: I am having a VERY similar issue with my 2 year old.  There are only a couple of possibilities with the water drinking.  1)Diabetes Melitus- regular diabetes.  You should have his pediatrician check his urine for sugar and ketones.2) Diabetes Insipidus- not like regular diabetes, it relates to the hormone that causes the kidneys to produce urine.  In that case the kidneys over production of urine causes the extreme thirst.  It's usually diagnosed by MRI (for central diabetes insipidus) or blood tests.3) Psycogenic water drinking- An attachment to drinking water, but usually they dont wake up at night to drink.My 2 year old has been drinking water for almost 4 months, waking at night to drink, has dry skin on hands, feet and scalp and is having occasional instances of Ketosis with acetone breath and ketones in her urine.  We've had an MRI but everything looked normal.  At this point, Im really pushing for a pediatric Endocrinologist.I wish you the best of luck in finding answers for your little one.  Dont let it slide, if he's crying for water something is probably going on.Callie

question: I am a pharmacist, so obviously my mind tracks to areas that sometimes it shouldnt...but this is something that I haven't been able to shake.  My son, who is about 3 and a half...wakes up every morning, and the first words out of his mouth are I want something to eat and something to drink.  He doesnt go for very long without asking for a drink, or saying he is thirsty...and acting so pitiful about it too.  His lips are almost always dry/chapped looking...but he is always peeing.  We will go potty, and it will be a good bit.  And not but 10 minutes later, he is having to go again!  I havent seen any weight loss.  He wakes up in the middle of the night sometimes crying hysterically, and it seems like the only thing he wants is a glass of water, that he will CHUG and then pass out again.  He has recently been going to bed a LOT earlier than usual...falling asleep in the car, etc.  I attributed it to early mornings, but that doesnt seem right either.  Sometimes he acts a little spacy- but I dont know about that either.  He always has had a problem with rashes on his butt and legs area, and they just never seem to go away.  I just dont know what is NORMAL for him to be drinking, or if this is something to legitimately be concerned about.  My dad's father had diabetes, but that is all for the family history.  Any suggestions or ideas?  I plan on giving the pediatrician a call, but it is still a concern.  Thanks!  Nichole
title: 3.5yr old always asking for a drink?
